1_17gEFavobc7RsKNGbSzZwoSZ6jNB7hT2KN.body:
Use this guide http://127.0.0.1:43110/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe/using_zeronet/create_new_site/
Here's a summary of it:

- Use "zeronet.py siteCreate"
- Store your private key somewhere safe
- Go to the folder with the address of the created site, that's in /data in your ZeroNet folder
-  Put your static site in that folder, with an "index.html", which is the first page someone sees when browsing your site with just your address.
- When done, sign it with "zeronet.py siteSign YOUR_ADDRESS"
- And then publish it with  "zeronet.py sitePublish YOUR_ADDRESS"

> [oren](#comment_4_1ET7iT2Cot3uksKiR9TEvj5RSpqRUgJiso): http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PKH11Tjj6ssfBY3L132DZ4b3d1ezuu5d    my hello world!

Getting "content.json download failed". Maybe sign and publish your site again

GPLv2 is incompatible with GPLv3, and here's why you should upgrade to GPLv3:

4_1FTFKztuv4Z5uy6iS83k9hB2xtS6yFnDxx.body:
> [kindlyfire](#comment_12_1FTFKztuv4Z5uy6iS83k9hB2xtS6yFnDxx): Your issues should be resolved. It is now usable over HTTPS.
> Sometimes it will still refuse to load the font, but only if you use a remote server without HTTPS. (locally seems to work though)

Download http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/webfont/1/webfont.js and put it in your site locally, it's ZeroNet...
It's in pacman.js' FontLoader function, use local assets please.

> [kindlyfire](#comment_15_1FTFKztuv4Z5uy6iS83k9hB2xtS6yFnDxx): I did not choose to use G. Fonts for loading fonts, the games did (they are open-source, not made by me). I will try to make it better :)

Yes, sorry... thought you made these :)
I think you can find the bits that load the external font in each Javascript file for each game at the same location.
Anyway, thanks for the mirror!
